hr.fer.zemris.java.cstr

Class CString

  • java.lang.Object
    • hr.fer.zemris.java.cstr.CString

  • public class CString
extends java.lang.Object
    Different implementation of String class. This class offers all the basic functionality that the mentioned String class offers, only difference being the complexity of substring(int, int) and similar methods, which is in this case O(1).

    CString objects are immutable, and every method that modifies some part of the CString returns a new object.

    Unless otherwise noted, passing a null argument to a constructor or method in this class will cause a IllegalArgumentException to be thrown.

    Author:
    Dan

    • Constructor Detail

      • CString

        public CString(char[] data,
               int offset,
               int length)
        Allocates a new CString that contains characters from a subarray of the character array argument. The contents of the subarray are copied; subsequent modification of the character array does not affect the newly created CString.
        Parameters:
        data - array that is the source of characters
        offset - index of the first character, in data array, that is part of this CString
        length - length of this CString
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the offset and length arguments index characters outside the bounds of the data array

      • CString

        public CString(char[] data)
        Allocates a new CString that contains characters from the character array argument. The contents of the array are copied; subsequent modification of the character array does not affect the newly created CString.
        Parameters:
        data - array that is the source of characters

      • CString

        public CString(CString original)
        Initializes a newly created CString object so that it represents the same sequence of characters as the argument. The newly created CString is a copy of the argument string.
        Parameters:
        original - CString to copy

    • Method Detail

      • fromString

        public static CString fromString(java.lang.String s)
        Returns a CString object so that it represents the same sequence of characters as the argument.
        Parameters:
        s - String to copy
        Returns:
        CString that is a copy of the argument string

        Parameters:

        the character at given index
        Throws:

      • toCharArray

        public char[] toCharArray()
        Converts this CString to a new character array.
        Returns:
        a newly allocated character array whose length is the length of this CString and whose contents are initialized to contain the character sequence represented by this CString

        Returns:

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(char c)
        Returns the index within this CString of the first occurrence of the specified character. If no such character occurs in this CString, then -1 is returned.
        Parameters:
        c - a character
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurrence of the character in the character sequence represented by this object, or -1 if the character does not occur

      • startsWith

        public boolean startsWith(CString s)
        Tests if this CString starts with the specified prefix.
        Parameters:
        s - the prefix
        Returns:
        true if the character sequence represented by the argument is a prefix of the character sequence represented by this CString; false otherwise. Note also that true will be returned if the argument is empty.

      • endsWith

        public boolean endsWith(CString s)
        Tests if this CString ends with the specified suffix.
        Parameters:
        s - the suffix
        Returns:
        true if the character sequence represented by the argument is a suffix of the character sequence represented by this CString; false otherwise. Note also that true will be returned if the argument is empty.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(CString s)
        Tests if this CString contains the specified CString.
        Parameters:
        s - the sequence to search for
        Returns:
        true if this CString contains given argument, false otherwise. Note also that true will be returned if the argument is empty.

      • substring

        public CString substring(int startIndex,
                         int endIndex)
        Returns a new CString that is a substring of this CString . The substring begins at the specified startIndex and extends to the character at index endIndex - 1.
        Parameters:
        startIndex - the beginning index, inclusive.
        endIndex - the ending index, exclusive.
        Returns:
        the specified substring
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if indexes are out of bounds of this CString

      • left

        public CString left(int n)
        Returns a new CString which represents starting part of this CString and is of given length.
        Parameters:
        n - length
        Returns:
        the specified substring
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if length is out of bounds of this CString

      • right

        public CString right(int n)
        Returns a new CString which represents ending part of this CString and is of given length.
        Parameters:
        n - length
        Returns:
        the specified substring
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if length is out of bounds of this CString

      • add

        public CString add(CString s)
        Concatenates the specified CString to the end of this CString. If the length of the argument CString is 0, then this CString object is returned.
        Parameters:
        s - the CString that is concatenated to the end of this CString
        Returns:
        a CString that represents the concatenation of this object's characters followed by the CString argument's characters

      • replaceAll

        public CString replaceAll(char oldChar,
                          char newChar)
        Returns a new CString resulting from replacing all occurrences of oldChar in this CString with newChar. If the character oldChar does not occur in the character sequence represented by this CString object, then a reference to this CString object is returned.
        Parameters:
        oldChar - the old character
        newChar - the new character
        Returns:
        a CString derived from this CString by replacing every occurrence of oldChar with newChar

      • replaceAll

        public CString replaceAll(CString oldStr,
                          CString newStr)
        Replaces each substring of this CString that matches the literal oldStr sequence with the specified literal newStr sequence. The replacement proceeds from the beginning of the CString to the end.
        Parameters:
        oldStr - the substring to be replaced
        newStr - the replacement substring
        Returns:
        the resulting CString
